PastSimpleExs.Ar: جاء علي إلى المدرسة الأسبوع الماضي.
PastSimpleExs.Affirmative: Ali came to school last week.
PastSimpleExs.Negative: Ali didn't come to school last week.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did Ali come to school last week?

PastSimpleExs.Negative: It was not cold last month.

PastSimpleExs.Affirmative: You lost the keys last week.
PastSimpleExs.Negative: You didn't lose the keys last week.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did you lose the keys last week?

PastSimpleExs.Affirmative: Ahmed read two books last month.
PastSimpleExs.Negative: Ahmed didn't read two books last month.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did Ahmed read two books last month?

PastSimpleExs.Negative: She didn't work in Cairo in 2005.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did she work in Cairo in 2005?

PastSimpleExs.Affirmative: You went to the party yesterday
PastSimpleExs.Negative: You didn't go to the party yesterday
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Why didn't you go to the party yesterday?

PastSimpleExs.Ar: انفجرت السيارة في الساعة 9:30 صباحًا الأسبوع الماضي.
PastSimpleExs.Affirmative: The car exploded at 9.30am last week.
PastSimpleExs.Negative: The car didn't explode at 9.30am last week.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did the car explode at 9.30 am last week?

PastSimpleExs.Negative: She didn't go to the door.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did whe go to the door.

PastSimpleExs.Affirmative: We heard the telephone last hour.
PastSimpleExs.Negative: We did not hear the telephone last hour.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did we heard the telephone last hour last hour.

PastSimpleExs.Negative: You didn't watch TV last night.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did you watch TV last night?

PastSimpleExs.Ar: كنت أعيش في هذا المنزل عندما كنت صغيرًا.
PastSimpleExs.Affirmative: I lived in that house when I was young.
PastSimpleExs.Negative: I didn't live in that house when I was young.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did I live in that house when I was young?

PastSimpleExs.Negative: You didn't play tennis last week.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did you play tennis last week?

PastSimpleExs.Affirmative: I lived in Bangkok for 10 years.
PastSimpleExs.Negative: I didn't live in Bangkok for 10 years.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did I live in Bangkok for 10 years?

PastSimpleExs.Affirmative: We sang at the concert last day.
PastSimpleExs.Negative: We did not sing at the concert last day.
PastSimpleExs.Interrogative: Did we sing at the concert last day?

PastContinuousExs.Ar: كنت ألعب كرة القدم عند الساعة السادسة صباحا.
PastContinuousExs.Affirmative: I was playing football at 6:00 a.m.
PastContinuousExs.Negative: I was not playing football at 6:00 a.m.
PastContinuousExs.Interrogative: Was I playing football at 6:00 a.m?

PastContinuousExs.Negative: He was not eating yesterday afternoon.

PastContinuousExs.Ar: كانوا يشاهدون برنامجًا وثائقيًا في نهاية الأسبوع الماضي.
PastContinuousExs.Affirmative: They were watching a documentary program last weekend.
PastContinuousExs.Negative: They weren't watching a documentary program last weekend.
PastContinuousExs.Interrogative: Were they watching a documentary program last weekend?

PastContinuousExs.Ar: لم يكن علي يقرأ كتابًا مساء أمس.
PastContinuousExs.Affirmative: Ali was reading a book yesterday evening.
PastContinuousExs.Negative: Ali wasn't reading a book yesterday evening.
PastContinuousExs.Interrogative: Was ali reading a book yesterday evening?

PastContinuousExs.Ar: كنت أدرس اللغة الإنجليزية صباح أمس.
PastContinuousExs.Affirmative: I was studying English yesterday morning.
PastContinuousExs.Negative: I wasn't studying English yesterday morning.
PastContinuousExs.Interrogative: Was I studying English yesterday morning?

PastContinuousExs.Ar: لم نكن نشاهد مباراة كرة قدم في الساعة 6 مساءً.
PastContinuousExs.Affirmative: We were watching a football match at 6 pm.
PastContinuousExs.Negative: We weren't watching a football match at 6 pm.
PastContinuousExs.Interrogative: Were we watching a football match at 6 pm?

PastContinuousExs.Ar: كنت تلعب كرة القدم الليلة الماضية.
PastContinuousExs.Affirmative: You were playing football last night.
PastContinuousExs.Negative: You weren't playing football last night.
PastContinuousExs.Interrogative: Were you playing football last night?

PastContinuousExs.Ar: كان يأكل الشوكولا في الرابعة صباحا؟
PastContinuousExs.Affirmative: He was eating chocolate at 4 a.m.
PastContinuousExs.Negative: He wasn't eating chocolate at 4 a.m.
PastContinuousExs.Interrogative: Was he eating chocolate at 4 a.m.?

PastPerfectExs.Affirmative: After the film had started, I arrived.
PastPerfectExs.Negative: After the film hadn't started, I arrived.
PastPerfectExs.Interrogative: Had the film started after, I arrived?

PastPerfectExs.Ar: لقد فشلت في الاختبار لأنني كنت قد درست من أجله.
PastPerfectExs.Affirmative: I failed the test because I had studied for it.
PastPerfectExs.Negative: I failed the test because I had not studied for it.
PastPerfectExs.Interrogative: Had I failed the test because I didn't study for it?

TensesTitles.title: Past Tense
TensesTitles.desc: A tense expressing an action that has happened or a state that previously existed.

TensesTitles.title: Present Tense
TensesTitles.desc: A tense expressing an action that is currently going on or habitually performed, or a state that currently or generally exists.

TensesTitles.title: Future tense
TensesTitles.desc: A tense expressing an action that has not yet happened or a state that does not yet exist.

PastTensesTitles.title: Past Simple
PastTensesTitles.desc: The past simple  is used to talk about events that occurred in the past at a specific time.

PastTensesTitles.title: Past Continuous
PastTensesTitles.desc: We use the past continuous is used to talk about actions and events that lasted for a specific period of time in the past.

PastTensesTitles.title: Past Perfect
PastTensesTitles.desc: We used the past perfect refers to a time earlier than before now. It is used to make it clear that one event happened before another in the past.
